numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Nearly all surveyed countries exist.
2. In nearly all surveyed countries, more young people believe that the world is getting better than middle-aged people and older people.
3. Young people are people that have an age of at least 15 years and that have an age of at most 24 years.
4. Middle-aged people and older people are people that have an age of at least 40 years.
5. No significant outlier country exists.
6. No significant outlier country has the opposite relationship.
7. I noticed a differential between young people and middle-aged people and older people.
8. In some countries, the differential is greatest.
9. The United States is such a country.
10. Japan is such a country.
11. The United States has a relatively low population growth rate.
12. Japan has a relatively low population growth rate.
13. I learned something in my human geography class.
14. Such relationships can exacerbate issues for the older dependent population.
15. I wonder if this is one reason.
16. Older people tend to have a more pessimistic viewpoint about where society is headed.
17. I wonder why some countries are overwhelmingly positive in their views across the board.
18. Indonesia is such a country.
19. I wonder why some countries are overall very negative.
20. I think that the situation of internal affairs within a country likely influences these views.
21. I am not familiar with the political systems of each country.
22. I think that a political system can have a significant impact on people's world views.
23. The title of this graph could be: Is the world improving with the new generation?
24. The new generation thinks so.
